Description: Fragment of neck and handle root of Attic black-figured pottery neck-amphora; interior: glazed black, band in added red around top of neck just below junction with rim; exterior: frieze of opposing lotuses (added red on calyxes) and palmettes (added red on alternating leaves), linked by three rows of circles connected by double incised lines; diamond-shaped reserved areas in the interstices; handle roughly glazed black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Piekarski gives the attribution near the Swing Painter. Stylistically the lotus palmette frieze is similar to that on Boston 00.331 (ABV 307.62; CVA Boston 1, pl.33; Bohr 1982, no. 131. pls. 132-135.191a), but no parallel has emerged for the linking three rows of circles connected by incised lines with diamonds in the squares between.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 39, no. C9, pl. 13,, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0864)
